content:
I try to open https://live.lean-lang.org/ and it opens with blank editor.
I open DevTools and notice that URL
https://live.lean-lang.org/api/manifest/mathlib-demo did not open. Is this something on my side? And is this even proper place to ask?
Works for me at the moment, unfortunately. Maybe you can debug this on your side some more? Different browsers, different devices if possible?
Just to clarify. Second link working for you? I try on PC + WiFi, mobile + GSM, also ask friend from other country to check that link and it report that it cannot GET
The second link does not work for me, but the first one opens a blank VSCode-like editor, where I can type Lean commands.

Checking (Linux, Firefox ESR, eduroam in Germany): live.lean-lang.org works for me; the second link (with mathlib-demo) "does not": it opens a page that is blank except for the text Cannot GET /api/manifest/mathlib-demo
(I'm not sure that the second link does not work, I see Cannot GET /api/manifest/mathlib-demo opening it, which I take to mean that something went wrong... :smile: )
It somehow start working on my Windows chrome, and after I check couple times it start working on my phone too. So I think itâ€™s magic and gremlins
Also, here Linux, Firefox, my university WiFi in the UK.
Andrii Kurdiumov has marked this topic as resolved.

You're right that there seems to be a bug and it cannot read the manifest, thanks for spotting. I'll try to get back to doing work maybe next week and I'll try to look at that, too.

However, not being able to GET the manifest should only affect the info (currently not) displayed under "Menu > Lean Info", where it is supposed to show you all package versions currently used. It should not influence the working of the editor itself
I noticed a few days ago that the the Impressum didn't load either (guessing it's the same issue?).
That sounds like a nice feature, in particular for bug reporters using live.lean-lang.org to create mwe's.
